intro: Knautia clementii, commonly known as the Alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Knautia clementii is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters, making it a striking addition to mountainous landscapes.
